alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 04 at 5:31PM CDT until October 04 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR WESTERN LUBBOCK AND EAST CENTRAL HOCKLEY COUNTIES... At 530 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Reese Center, or 9 miles west of Lubbock, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. Two inch hail was reported along Highway 114 near the Hockley and Lubbock County line. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Woodrow, Reese Center, New Deal, and Lubbock Science Spectrum. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
